intro: Hieracium ozanonis, commonly known as the Ozano's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in a composite head, which is characteristic of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium ozanonis is native to parts of southern Europe and is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates.
